p: The laboratory repellence test was conducted using the standard human-bait technique of WHO (2009) and Kazembe and Nkomo (2012). Three human volunteers were used in the experiments. An area of 7 by 7 cm (49 cm2) was marked and cut open on plastic disposable hand gloves, manufactured by Ahmedabad, Gujarat (India). The edges of the cut area were lined with masking tape.
